pull.title: fs: consistently use fsbridge:: for ifstream / ofstream
pull.body: These changes are part of #20744, but are also ok to do now, and reduce the diff in that PR. See commit messages for details. Revived from #23857.

verification.payload:
tree a32a921d64bdf482fbbca9f14d466fbdf1d2877e
parent e3699b71c46bf66cfe363fc76ab8761dc39555a7
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1640333942 +0800
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1643206099 +0800

fs: consistently use fsbridge for {i,o}fstream

Part of #20744, but this can be done now, and will simplify the diff.

events.message:
fs: consistently use fsbridge for {i,o}fstream

Part of #20744, but this can be done now, and will simplify the diff.

verification.payload:
tree 5a4a2447fc5685109561a4f6c3dac2beb7df9944
parent 21f781ad7921ebda9f38a6be362e23750d8cd5a6
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1640334278 +0800
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1643206109 +0800

fs: add missing <cassert> include

This is needed to prevent compilation failures once boost is removed,
however is still correct to include now, and reduces the diff in #20744.

<string> is extracted from the defines because it is used for Windows
and non-Windows code, i.e get_filesystem_error_message().

events.message:

and non-Windows code, i.e get_filesystem_error_message().

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#20744](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20744) (Use std::filesystem. Remove Boost Filesystem & System by fanquake)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

comments.body: unrelated question for follow-up: Why is this safe? Shouldn't this use PathFromString?
